meanings.definition: Too ripe; past the prime of ripeness.
meanings.sent1: The banana was overripe and mushy.
meanings.sent2: The fruit had turned overripe and was starting to spoil.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the overripe tomato looked like it had partied too hard.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the overripe fruit filled the room like a heavy fog.
meanings.sent5: The overripe apple was so soft, it felt like holding a cloud.

meanings.definition: To become too ripe or past the prime of ripeness.
meanings.sent1: If you leave the bananas out too long, they will overripe quickly.
meanings.sent2: The peaches began to overripe on the tree before we could pick them.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally let the strawberries overripe, turning them into mush.
meanings.sent4: The neglected fruit continued to overripe on the counter, forgotten by all.
meanings.sent5: The warm weather caused the fruit to overripe faster than expected.
